body:
[Split-flap displays](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Split-flap_display) are found in train stations and airports.

I've managed to come across a couple of salvaged displays originally manufactured by Krone (and I suspect based on an AEG design), and have finally gotten around building the necessary hardware. I will fill this wiki with information about them soon, until then enjoy a couple of YouTube videos of my experiments:
* [First try](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A9URJjZWAYg&list=UUemgVq-wKZldT_PzoR9ghBg&index=5&feature=plcp)
* [Reading the position](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j3VEMtKQg_M&list=UUemgVq-wKZldT_PzoR9ghBg&index=4&feature=plcp)
* [Version 3](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dMldK1i_HyY&list=UUemgVq-wKZldT_PzoR9ghBg&index=1&feature=plcp)
